Articles.Content:
I downloaded v1.0.0.0 demo for Mac. I can click on Start game in the main menu and that takes me to the Start Game sub-menu, but "Resume Saved" "Start New" and "Training" do nothing. "Back" takes me back to the main menu. Any ideas?

byedidia

No I'm baffled byedidia, can you please see [**here**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92228-Known-Issues-Self-Help) and [**here**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-%21%21%21-PLEASE-READ-BEFORE-POSTING-%21%21%21-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide), we'll need to see the game logs to figure out what's going on.

Hi,

I have installed v1.0.0.0 demo on OS X 10.10.3. I can successfully click from the main menu to the start game menu. In the start game menu "Resume Saved", "Start New" and "training" all do nothing. "Back" takes me back to the main menu. 

Any ideas?

Thanks,

byedidia
Hello again byedidia, we cannot help you if you do not help us by providing the logs that KSP makes, there is no telling what is causing thins on your system without them.

Hi, I've got the same problem.

I'm running the demo (1.0.0.0) on a Macbook air (13-inch, Mid 2012).

In the start game sub-menu none of the options do anything; only the back button works. 

**Here's the log:**

Flin

It looks like maybe there's some files missing, something the Unity engine does is use local URL's to find data files.

Check your saves folder, make sure you have Training and Scenarios, if you made a save already there should be a Default folder as well.

The Default folder should contain a persistent.sfs and both a VAB and SPH folder, if any of these are missing the game can fail to load anything on the New Game screen.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-16T08:28:22Z" title="09/16/2015 08:28  AM" data-short="8 yr">September 16, 2015</time> by sal\_vager**

This looks to be it eNamel5.

> 
> DirectoryNotFoundException: Directory '/Applications/saves/training' not found.

The saves folder is usually in the Kerbal Space Program folder, not in Applications so why it is looking in Applications is unknown, all I can suggest is you try reinstalling to a new location and verify that saves is in Kerbal Space Program.
Hi.  I have the same problem. I have the Training and Scenarios folder but no persistent.sfs or a VAB and a SPH folder.
